Reviews.Title: “Not recomended”
Reviews.Author: Katrina J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We choses this hotel because it was cheep and had breakfast included. I expected a low quality room but i was amazed at how low quality it was. Our room was small with mould on the wall, we were next to the shared toilet and could hear people in the toilet at all hours. The bed had springs that dug into you and our window didnt shut fully so sleeping was difficult. The breakfast included eggs that sometimes ran out, cold toast and a small selection of cold meat. The hotel is situated about a half hour walk from the train station and city center but there is a tram that you can catch. The hotel staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Raja G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good. Pleasent and Nice. Good. Pleasent and nice Good. Pleasent and nice Good. Pleasent and nice Good. Pleasent and nice Good. Pleasent and niceGood. Pleasent and nice

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bill210
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we felt very welcome, unfortunatly due to some issues our booking was cancelled, as our first trip to amsterdam we didnt know what to do, The male manager of the hotel was very helpful as was his wife, they let us stay the first two nights and helped us to find somewhere else. As we went for 7 days and had no accomodation booked we had no choice but to go to a hostal type place which was horrible as we booked a twin room and ended up in a form with 4 others for 3 nights. No fault of Hotel Kooyk. We then checked back in for our last 2 nights before leaving the early hours of this morning. Before going i was very worried about what i had read about rats, vermin, cleanliness etc. The hotel was very clean, there were no rats or vermin anywhere, the staff were very pleasent and helpful. Breakfast wasn't the greatest, ham,cheese,bread,toast,chocolate spread,jam,marmalade etc. But it was something to eat and the most beautiful coffee. I Would happily return to this hotel in the future and i advise anyone on a tight budget to book up here, it's completely worth the money, especially if you get one of the new rooms, we had room 3, the door didnt lock so anyone could get in there but we had locks on our cases so that didnt bother us too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, budget accom but clean and appropriate”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying here as I tend to like my own toilet/bathroom, well if you have one of the superior rooms that is what you will get, the staff were lovely, from checking in, the breakfast team and the manager when we checked out. They are refurbishing the rest of the hotel in November 2012, if the bathrooms are going to be the same quality as they ones we were in - then you are all in for a treat. Would definately go again as its easy to find from the airport, bus 197 from the airport for EUR 4 each way, and then a short walk to the hotel. Central to all, close to the museumplein, 20 mins walk to the town (so long as you don't get lost along the canals).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ive stayed in better hostels!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christy1988
Reviews.Content: Quite central an easy to find from the airport, room appeared to be clean but when i came home i had bites all over me seems to be from bed bugs... Now reading other reviews seems to be the case! No bathroom in the room its down the hallway you have own bathroom per room they were quite modern, breakfast is continental so boiled eggs an cold toast! Its more a bad hostel than hotel id rather of paid the extra an stayed somewhere else, friendly staff but would never go back oh and very very steep stairs!!! If you do stay here take own duvet covers an bath towels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers, with rodents!”
Reviews.Author: jamie r
Reviews.Content: If you do not want to have rodents crawling all over you, do not stay here! We were moved rooms and even that room was infested! ended up walking the streets from 3.30am-8.30am. Booked in to a different hotel and spoke to the owner and asked for a refund for the nights that we wouldnt be staying, but owner refused and shouted at us, then stormed off, then cried, then shouted at us again! what a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Discusting- Rodent infestation”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival at hotel kooyk we found that it was in a good location. Upon being shown to our room we found that it was infested with rodents. We were then moved to a second room after being told there were no other rooms available to be woken at 3am to rodents crawling over our luggage. We then felt we could no longer stay there and walked the streets from 3:30 am until 8:30 am and find ourselves another hotel. We returned to hotel kooyk at 8:30am to speak to the hotel owner about the situation and ask for a refund for the remainder of our stay to be talked to aggresivley and be shouted at and he then stormed off. When he returned he burst into tears saying he couldn't give us a refund and that the rodents were ruining his business and he had been trying to catch them for several weeks. Disgusting- do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in general”
Reviews.Author: Nausheen I Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Love the Kooyk hotel! The people are very nice and helpful. We had a great time there and its close to everything, literally. The only thing I wasn't impressed is the shared bathroom with boys. Since they have three bathroom, I think they should have made one specifically for women, the same goes to the washroom. But in general it's a great, affordable place for those who just want to crash at night :)

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: James B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We payed Â£120 for three nights for the two of us including breakfast. I personally think that for the money the hotel was great. I sometimes read negative reviews by people of these budget hotels and cant understand what the problem is. The room was quite basic but it was clean and nice. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was basic but again for the price there is only so much you can expect. Hot coffee, toast and egg is enough to get me going in the morning. I was reluctant about a shared toilet/shower as I usually wouldnt take this option but both were very clean every time. The location was great right in the centre near lots of coffee shops and bars and the main shopping area. All in all a great hotel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Rat Shack!!”
Reviews.Author: Beki14
Reviews.Content: Seriously Disgusting!! It was a disaster from the beginning. Upon arrival was met by a seriously -- woman who snapped at me constantly! However I was on holiday with 2 friends and we just laughed it off. After finding our room at the end of a damp soaked hall way, we opened our door to find a manky room which smelt like urine! The floor was damp and the beds still looked as though they had been left a mess from the previous people staying. After further inspection we found that our balcony door (which led on to the street) did not lock and was shared with other people who could just walk into our room. We then decided to go look for the shared shower, which we discovered was one shower for the whole floor (about 30 people) which consisted of a cupboard filled with bugs and a door which did not lock. Being 3 girls we were not happy about the door not locking but had no other options. The toilet which was also shared by the whole floor was also covered in urine and bugs and did not get cleaned in the whole time we stayed (although i seen nothing getting cleaned so I donâ€™t know why I was surprised). However me and my friends decided we could deal with the stench and mess (mainly because we had no money to find alternative arrangements) and stayed. However on the second night we were awoken to the sound of scratching and seen mice running all over the floor!! We convinced ourselves they would not come near us and took turns sleeping only to be awoken a short time later with rats crawling over us in our sleep!! We left immediately where we got snapped at by the owner again even after our complaints where we got told we were over reacting! Insted we went and slept on the street which seemed a safer alternative!!! After leaving we discovered we all had flea bites and were all very ill!! Do not stay here unless you like to share your bed with rats and bugs and enjoy people having access to your room and being able to walk in on you showering!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Guess I didn't get one of the Fabulous New Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty terrible. More or less everything in the room I stayed in was broken...bed, lamp, sink, wardrobe, sink, tiles, tv remote...I could go on. Worse still, quite a few things could have been easily fixed in a few minutes at zero cost - I got the impression that they just didn't care. Also, the separate shower room and bathroom were moldy and the locks didn't work. On the plus side, I'll probably never forget it :-)

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for the Price! Great new rooms! Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: The Kooyk Hotel is right beside the inner-most canal, just off Leidseplein. Staff were very informed about the city and its attractions, and eager to help. Got one the new rooms - worth the extra money (25 Euro extra, I remember). Has a garden room so nice and quiet and restful. Breakfast included was great value as it included in the price. Lots to eat and great coffee! If I do return to lovely Amsterdam, I will be sure to stay with the nice people of the Kooyk. Ask for one of the newly renovated rooms with full private bathroom. Well worth the slightly extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe Everything on Here!!! It Is a Lovely Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattooty
Reviews.Content: To start out with this review- the review by Craig A (dirty and creepy) is written by a disgruntled employee, so DO NOT believe a word of it, it is written out of spite, he should be ashamed of himself for writing it and making false statements. This hotel is awesome, for what it costs!! My husband and I, and our son and daughter in law have stayed here many times, since the 1990's!! Pierre and Mary - the owners have actually become good friends of ours, because thats what kind of people they are - they have a great sense of humor, and they make you feel right at home, they are good down to earth people. It's a beautiful Amsterdam hotel, with old world charm, I always felt like a guest at someones' home!!. The breakfasts are really nice, lots of good food, and hot coffee and everyone is always friendly, willing to help you in any way they can. Lately, they have even updated some of their rooms and some have private toilets now. We really loved the room facing the courtyard, because we could go out late at night, and have a really good afternoon nap the next day, as it's so quiet, you wouldn't even know it's in a city!! On the other side of the hotel, you have a beautiful view of the canal. We always found everything clean, and maybe it is old, but that's part of the charm of this place. The city of Amsterdam is old - it's been around for a long time - why stay at a hotel that feels like it could be any city on earth?? The toilets and showers are shared, but it is a budget hotel, not everyone wants to spend a few hundred euros a night , for a place to sleep, I sure don't. There is so much to do in Amsterdam, why would you want to spend your days in your room , anyway?? We had inquired at the American Hotel, which is right around the corner , the cost of their rooms, and it was at the time, about 6 times as much as the Kooyk a night - it may be more, now, I don't know!! It's in a great location and you can walk just a short ways to the tram and get anywhere you want. Surrounded by beautiful parks, flowers and grass, and the canal, that's what I remember. The only thing I don't like??....is that I can't be there right now!!

Reviews.Title: “The people make this place!”
Reviews.Author: Kkatie0
Reviews.Content: My partner and i arrived in Amsterdam and spent the day doing the typical tourist things and headed to our hotel in the evening. It was not hard to find at all. Its location is fantastic, especially for the price. When we arrived we were slightly scared by the door, we couldn't open it (you need the card to your room) and waited around for about 10 minutes until someone came to the door. When we were greeted by a lovely Dutch guy we were no longer worried! The reception area is clean and full of vouchers which as we were on a cheap visit was amazing! We were allocated our room which was on the first floor - with the view of the canal! I sent the hotel an email before hand explaining that it was my boyfriends 21st birthday so we got a very nice upgraded room free of charge! This shows just how kind the owners are to this place. The room was really spacious with a small sink and tele in there and they even supplied towels ... did not expect this! The shared shower was a bit of a pain as there was no room to get changed at all, it was a case of dashing back to the room in your towel but the showers are pretty close to all rooms, ours was the furthest away and it still only took, what, 5 seconds to head back to the room?! The breakfast in the morning was simple but my boyfriend loved it! I unfortunately can't eat wheat so i couldn't enjoy any toast or sandwiches and don't like egg but the unlimited fruit juice was nice! Maybe a suggestion of yogurts or fresh fruit would be good for people like me?! Overall, this hotel was absolutely brilliant for the money i paid for it. The location is fab and at the end of the day ... who stays in the hotel room for long anyway when you've gone to visit a city?! The staff really make this hotel too, ever so friendly and will attend to your every need. If i visit again i will defiantly but going back here. Thanks for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, flies everywhere”
Reviews.Author: LorealWilliams
Reviews.Content: I only gave it 2 out of 5, because it was the cheapest hotel out of the ones we got to choose from. Don't expect anything fancy! It is better than a hostel, but the bottom of a hotel range so you pick what you want. There were fruit flies everywhere in our hotel room. They didn't both us, just weren't fun to look at and wouldn't dare take food in our hotel room. Who stays in the hotel when they are in Amsterdam, though? If you are looking for cheap, private places to sleep I would recommend this place. If you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere. The breakfast in the morning was complimentary and FABULOUS. The man running it was brilliant, very keen and meeting everyone's needs. Location was great, but definitely have to utilize the tram system in order to get around the city. There was a tram stop right outside the hotel. Liedsplein was right down the street walking, too, which is a big night life area that you will probably hang around at least one night.

Reviews.Title: “I was so worried because of bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Cara R
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying here because the previous reviews were terrible. But we could'nt fault this cheap and basic hotel. The location was perfect and easy to find, bus 197 from the airport, get off at leidesplein and walk behind the American hotel. The room was basic but clean, showers were powerful and clean. We arrived back one night at 4am to find are room had been cleaned and my PJ's had been folded!!! Loved it! The staff were mega friendly, loved the chocolate spread on toast. We will definatly be back. If you want cheap, a good location and a basic firendly hotel. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Grim, grim grim!”
Reviews.Author: lacasaserenaturismo
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at hotel Kooyk and won't be rushing back. Have stayed in many budget hotels in Amsterdam and this was the worst. The location is great, a stone's throw from the Leidseplein and on the canal, with an easy bus service to and from the airport just a 5 minute walk away. For some strange reason, we had to pay more than was originally quoted. The room was large and reasonably clean, with double doors leading onto a paved garden area, which we weren't allowed to use. The toilet takes ages to refill after flushing and, as it is shared amongst so many rooms and is in a tiny cupboard, isn't very pleasant. The shared shower is disgraceful; dirty, smelly and very claustrophobic. The breakfasts are OK but the staff are extremely unfriendly and have put up rather rude and offensive signs and posters on the corridor walls. It's a bit damp everywhere, but then Amsterdam is a very damp city! We'll definitely go back to Amsterdam again but won't consider returning to Hotel Kooyk.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Joanne D
Reviews.Content: As soon as the door opened the overwhelming smell of damp greater us and smothered us like a long lost friend, the shared shower I have had better on a camp site, I did not use the shared toilet as I ensured I used the facilities at restaurants!! Our bed was damp!!! the cupboards were falling apart my partner and I slept clothed so not to have our skin touch the sheets. We were in a ground floor room opposite the shared shower which was noisy and smelly, this room should not be used as a hotel room, it was like sleeping in a garage. We did not stay for breakfast and left almost as soon as we woke. Prior to returning to the hotel after checking in my partner and tried everything to find another hotel, no matter cost but unfortunately everywhere was fully booked!!!!! The location is good but the owners med totals a good look at the state of the, even given the price does not justify how disgusting this place made me feel, the smell of damp made me wretch!! Do not go spend Â£30 more and save yourself some dignity.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay when limited budget”
Reviews.Author: FlorenceGhent
Reviews.Content: The location is a very strong point of this hotel. It is really close to the 'Leidseplein', a very nice square with lots of bars and pubs. It's really in the middle of the center of the city. The hotel itself is allright. The room was clean. The toilet and shower are shared. The breakfast is quite basic but there was very nice fresh bread. The staff is friendly and helpfull. It was not my nicest stay ever, but it was good for the (very low) price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for budget accommodations”
Reviews.Author: WhereToNextt
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend and we both agreed that it's in a great location for the price we paid (approx US$100/night). The bus to the airport is literally 2 blocks away and the area is truly central to practically everything. The room was clean and spacious. Our beds were also extremely comfortable (the kind of mattresses that don't have springs so there's nothing stabbing you in the back). The communal bathroom and shower on the other hand were pretty small but manageable. The bathrooms weren't as well stocked as they could be but there's always someone around to ask for more toilet paper. The breakfast was decent, nothing spectacular. Be aware that they charge for internet/wifi usage (and we still couldn't get service). But again, the location is perfect and it's still quiet since it's by the canal. Also, I've got to say that Greg, one of the guys that works there, was so great! He had great recommendations and was super gracious! Always a smile on his face and a friendly disposition.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, great budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jenking62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on 20/06/11. The last few reviews reflect exactly what you get-CLEAN, budget accomodation, and good value for the price we paid @ e60 per night. Brill directions from the last review-bus 197 from airport, cant go wrong! Watch the loo on floor 2-situated in what appears to be a cupboard, it is not secure-my husband emerged with a bleeding forehead after banging his head on the door! Beds were comfortable, no noise at night. I had prepared to queue for the showers/toilet, but not once did I encounter this, or even dirty, soiled faciliies. On the whole, this is brilliantly priced accom, particularly for Amsterdam, and I spent ages researching accomodation in this city prior to my booking.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, great budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rachic
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was wonderful, right in the centre, but not in the hustle and bustle of the red light district and night life. It was really easy to get to from the airport, you simply get the 197 bus from the airport and get off at Leidseplein, which is simple as the buses have monitors on them telling you which stop is next and the bus drivers are helpful. It cost 4 euros and the hotel is literally a 2min walk from the bus stop. If you're struggling, ask/look for the American hotel on the corner and continue walking down that side of the front of the canal and you will come to it. We stayed at the Kooyk for 2 nights and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. We arrived a few hours before check in, and were leaving a few hours after check out and were able to store our luggage at the hotel whilst we enjoyed our time. We were in a double room, which was 2 single beds pushed together but they were comfortable. Our room had a wash basin and TV. The rooms were cleaned each day and fresh towels provided. The only downfall is the bathroom, not a problem for us at all, especially on a short stay, but the toilets and showers are communal, so if you have a problem sharing these, then this hotel wouldn't be suitable. If you're looking for a budget hotel, that's good for walking distance everywhere, comfortable beds at a reasonable price, then this is definitely the place in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: GemmaJayneStorey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hostels and 1 star hotels but this is definitely one of the best. we payed 54 euros for a twin room with breakfast. There was a sink in the room. The toilet was next door and the shower room down a small flight of stairs. Everything was clean and we were provided with towels. Breakfast was surpsisingly good for a 1 star hotel. There was a buffet of brown/white bread/toast, 4 types of salami, boiled eggs, gouda cheese, jam and honey, filter coffee and tea, and orange juice. The hotel staff were all very welcoming and helpful. We expected a disturbed night sleep (being a cheap hotel in the centre of Amsterdam) but slept through very well. It was only at 9am that we heard a lot of noise coming from one group of lads who had their window open which was opposite ours. It was in the centre of the city but far enough away frmo the Red Light district and train station. The owner allowed us to leave our luggage after we had checked out, i know some hotels say they do not allow this on their websites. The only problem I can think of was the steep stairs so if you struggle with stairs I wouldn't advise going there. Apart from that............Perfect for travelling on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maeve27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Trams stop just outside the hotel. It was a small hotel but it was clean. Breakfast was nice too. You can see that the hotel is old with old-style toilet (very tiny) but it's ok because it was very clean. The lady who checked us in, I think she was the owner, was very friendly and helpful. Ours was a twin room with balcony. It became very warm in the room during the night, we couldn't figure out how to turn down the heater. And we couldn't leave the balcony door open while sleeping for fear of someone entering through the balcony. But other than that, everything else was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: talktomeh
Reviews.Content: It's hard to call this place a Hotel. It is a Hostel, an average one at best. The only good thing about this place, apart from the location, is the bed. The one we had was comfortable. We paid 70 euros per night over a weekend in December. I wish we had stumped up an extra 20 euros as we would have got a lot more for our money. NONE of the rooms have their own toilet or shower. All rooms are shared bathrooms. We stayed on the ground floor and had to share a very small toilet (think of a closet) and shower with approximately 7 other people. When booking this wasn't mentioned so be careful. Come 7:30am all hell breaks loose. Pipes banging, toilets trying* to flush, tables moving, people stomping it was very hard to sleep after that. Definitely not a place for light sleepers. *The worst thing about the shared toilet was the length of time it took to refill the tank, we are talking at least 5 mins, so don't even consider a mercy flush or you will have a huge queue outside the door. The best part of my stay was some poor dutch girl coming down to reception in her PJ's and slippers, stating to the hotel guy "there is a small something in my room" while holding her fingers 7 - 9 inches apart. Either someone left an item from the Red Light District in the room, or the rodent mentioned in some previous reviews has returned, I suspect the latter. Can't comment on the breakfast, didn't have any. All in all for the money this place is pretty bad. I would not stay there again or tell a friend to. If you are travelling and looking for an average hostel to stay in, then maybe consider looking at booking this hostel, other than that just pay a little extra and get a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: pauldbris
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel only payed 42 euros definitely worth it in good location next to liedsplien and near all the museums only problem is no guests allowed. Room was quite big and got really warm had good nights sleep no noise even though in busy area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & Good location”
Reviews.Author: denli30
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel in a good location. When I booked the room, I didn't realize at first the bathroom facilities were shared, but we had a sink in our room. We also had a TV in our room. The hotel itself is a little run-down, musty, but it is VERY clean. The toilet, & shower were always clean. When we entered our room, it was clean. We had the room with the weird spot in the floor, but it was no bother. Oh, & the mouse comment from other reviewers... there are often mice in any place in Amsterdam if there is not a cat. This is why cafes & restaurants have cats living in them, keeps the mice away. We saw no mouse in the hotel & it is really clean. We did not have a chance to enjoy the breakfast, but there were good reviews. The noise level was pretty quiet until the morning. We were sleeping in and all the doors shutting in the morning made me crazy, but I am a light sleeper. Overall, it was very good. I would recommend to easy-going people who understand what a great value they are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for uncomplicated people”
Reviews.Author: krlitaa
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel comforable, clean and the included breakfast was very good. Coming from the USA, it is unsual to have this type of hotel. There is no elevator, the good thing is that the host helped us with the luggage up the stairs. The bathroom is very tiny and the shower bathroom is in a different hallway, also very tiny. The location of the hotel was perfect and in a safe area. I liked the hotel, it was just different from what I am used to in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: Jomkesana
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kyook is in a perfect location in Leidseplein - tons of public transportation, coffeshops, cafes, good restaurants, tons of nightclubs nearby and the St. Nicolaas Boat Club where you can get a cool boat ride around the canals. You can even hop on the public bus from the airport directly to Leidseplein, which is about 2 minutes walk away from the hotel. But like I said, that's all. My friends & I chose this hotel because they could accommodate all 7 of us in a room. The room was just ok, and had the old musty smell. The room had 2 wash basin in it. The shower is a flight down and the toilet is about 10 steps away from our room. There are no elevators, and the staircase are very steep. The shower & toilet can get very dirty in the evening. There was one night when the toilet ran out of toilet rolls! The breakfast was very basic and if they run out of bread, it's too bad - they don't do refills. I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “yuck!”
Reviews.Author: jade1202
Reviews.Content: We entered the room to find the carpet was saturated with water, the smell of dampness was overwhelming. As my partner stepped next to the bed his foot fell into a hollow where the floor board had rotted away under the carpet! We went and told them about the wet floor and they just said oh the rain must have come through the window, no offer to move us to a cleaner room. The shower was revolting, it was dirty and felt claustraphobic. It was in a good location but to cut a long story short it was really old and dirty, and unless you want to come away with chest infections, as I did, from the damp don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: craigybell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the vest budget hotels ive ever satyed at in eh dam. If it's just somewhere to put your head down at night and a free brekkie in eh morning. Then this is the place for you. My wife and i both loved this hotel bed was comfy brekkie was typical dutch breakfast(toast, jams,butter,cold meat and cheese) The only thing was the swhared bathroom but to be honest we never once had to wait for it. Always kept clean. I have read other peoples comments about this place. But they must have been expecting 3*+ it clearly states 1* the staff were very helpful and always a pleasure to talk to. We would recommend this place for any1 whos looking for a cheap,clean,cheerful and comfortable(the 4 c). place to stay and sleep. Was never once woke up at night. never heard any noise at night at all. Loved it so much were going back on the 25 october for 5 nights. Hope this info helps other like minded people like ourselfs(easygoing).

Reviews.Title: “What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: blue_bon_bon
Reviews.Content: Well me and my friends stayed for four nights and these were possibly the four worst nights ever. Firstly we had a mouse in our room on our first night which would not leave so i had no sleep at all that night i also saw it in the corridor having a midnight run, We told the staff about this in the morning and we were spoken to extremely rudely by the manager and were told that amsterdam is full of mice and to basically deal with it as she had for 30 or so years. We then asked to change rooms and were given a smaller room for 3 when we had arranged for four guests to stay so e were given an ultimatum either stay in the room with the mice or cramp all four of us into an extremely small room so we decided on the small room. So for the rest of the time we stayed we were all cramped and uncomfortable. The Male staff i have to say were slightly more understanding even though one did insult me!!! but the female star are rude and should not be dealing with customers!!! The toilet and shower are tiny cubicles and i did not try the breakfast due to the whole mouse episode all in all will not ever stay at this hotel again and would strongly advise anyone against it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation, would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_slovenia
Reviews.Content: Kooyk is located in Leidseplein, which is quite good. Rooms are upstairs and the stairs are dangerously steep. I booked single room but get double, which was quite big. Shower is very very small! Breakfest was horibble i didnt eat at all. Room was dirty especially walls. I would not stay there again, next time i will rather pay 10 E more for better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: hopskipjumptravel
Reviews.Content: Kooyk is located conveniently in Leidseplein. The rooms upstairs however are located rather inconveniently up some dangerously steep stairs. The people in the hotel are quite lovely. Unfortunately, they are much nicer than the facilities. Shared shower and toilet. Shower was relatively clean. Toilet could be likened to the urinals they had out on the street (during world cup) - the Leidseplein area reminded me of when I was in India! The stench of urine was overwhelming and dry retching inducing! Back at the hotel, I would have to say that it ceases to amaze me how males can still miss the bowl and shower the floor with their yellow fluid and not flush what they managed to get into the bowl - we know they're male because they left the seat up all the time! We were there during the summer and the room was rather hot. Breakfast was minimalistic. There might have also been bugs in the bed because I wasn't the one giving myself the bites. Anyhow, Kooyk is a budget hotel. If you are happy with stuffy hot rooms, shared facilities, cold toast and boiled eggs for breakfast in the convenient location of Leidseplein, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, pay a little more for something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireFruit
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfreind stayed in the Kooyk for 3 nights and the first night was the worst. I know alot of people have said the walls are thin and they really are. The first night a woman was crying all through the night in the room next door. (sounded like her and her partner were having an arguement, i couldn't tell as they weren't speaking English) This kept me up all night along with the constant banging of doors. The doors don't fit the frames properly and to shut them you have to slam them. I resorted to listening to Enya on my ipod! In the morning i decided to try out the shower. My boyfreind went first and he said it was okay apart from the fact it was super dingy. So i went downstairs and found a cockroach in the shower!! So for the whole stay i washed in the sink in the room. Couldn't wait to get home and have a shower after that. The toilet was more like a cupboard, i could just about fit in. The sink wasn't working in the toilet so you had to touch the handle everyone else had been using without washing their hands either. We never tried the breakfast even though it was included in the price, we ate out instead. Judging the hotel's amenities we thought the breakfast would be just as bad. We only met one member of staff on arrival and he seemed quite freindly. One good thing was that the rooms were clean and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Herodotus2143
Reviews.Content: I was struggling to find a cheap budget hotel in Amsterdam that looked reasonable, and eventualy settled on the Kooyk. Ultimately, I would have to say that I got exactly what I was looking for. There is no doubt that this hotel is very basic. The steep stairs (very steep!) make access difficult, especially with luggage, but were not a particular problem for me. The room was just about ok. Small and cramped, and the posituioning of the sink and furniture could have used a bit more thought. But the room was clean enough (no problems with bugs etc, or dampness, unlike some other reviewers). The hotel was fairly quiet (though I suspect that this is partly luck of the draw, but I also suspect it does not attract the rowdy boozer types). I had no problems sleeping. The bed wasn't the most comfortable, but was ok. Biggest problem with the room was that the door kept sticking, so that there was no way for me to go in or out of my room quietly, and I was constantly concerned about not being able to open the door at all! The shared facilities were equally basic. The toilets on each floor all seemed to have something missing - either soap for the sink, or towel, or spare toilet rolls. Breakfast was very good for a hotel of this quality. Boiled eggs, toast, cheese, meats, tea, coffee, all replensished frequently. Internet access was available, nominally for a fee, though I used it a number of times, and was not always charged. The best thing about this hotel would have to be the staff. All of them were very friendly and helpful. I was stuck there for several days more than intended due to the volcano, and found the manager in particular very helpful and reassuring in that time. The location is fine. Easily reached from Centraal station by trams 1, 2 or 5. Plenty of shops, bars and restaurants in the area, and not too far to walk to the centre, if you choose not to take the tram. Also just a few minutes walk from the Vondelpark, which was very pleasant for a morning walk after breakfast, followed by a cup of tea at the lakeside cafe in the centre of the park while watching the herons. If you are looking for a cheap basic hotel/hostel, then the Kooyk will do just fine, but if you are looking for any more than very basic, then this is probably not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: JFlan82
Reviews.Content: This hoStel (NOT hotel) is terribly run down. Looks as though it has not been renovated since at least the 60s. The toilet and douche (shower) were literally built in closets and smelled of urine. The "housekeepers" stole our own private towels on the second day and replaced them with the hostel towels. At this point we were not planning on taking these back with us anyhow, as the place was so skeevy I didn't want to bring back anything that I didn't have to. My boyfriend, his sister and I shared a 3 person room. His sister was eaten alive by some sort of insect/ bedbug, as was I, only not as severe as she. On the second to last evening there, there was a rodent in our room that ate the souvenir cheese one of us had purchased. The next morning, we saw a rodent scurry across the dining room floor as we were eating our breakfast. To share rooms with bugs and rodents is absolutely unsanitary and plain disgusting. Most nights we were there, there were many loud folk coming in at all hours of the night. We even had the pleasure of someone vomiting all over the wall, carpet and bathroom right outside of our bedroom door. It stunk the rest of the week. A lesson learned, I suppose. If the price sounds too good to be true, it is. Always remember, you get what you pay for. Just when you think a week for â‚¬580 you better add another â‚¬500 to that and get a REAL, clean hotel instead of this hoStel. One last bit, NEVER rely on what photos or a website looks like, it's very deceiving!

Reviews.Title: “great location and low price”
Reviews.Author: gr8ful47
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right around the corner from the happening Leidesplein! I brought a group on a very tight budget, and wanted cheapest possible accommodations that was not a hostel. I wanted a location that was near the Leidesplein and Museumplein, and I wanted a place that was clean and safe. I was happy with the Kooyk. Toilet was down the hall, shower was actually one floor up. Washbasin and sink in room. I was first person to use the shower in the morning and it was immaculate. Granted, if you use it after 8 other people you may find it no longer immaculate, but that is not surprising. The couple who run the Koyk were very nice and helpful and greeted us warmly. The place was quiet and reasonably clean for an older building. Thi is not a 'party place' but simple lodging. There is no ambience, but if you want a cheap and basic room to sleep in, a safe and excellent location that is steps from the Leidesplein and very convenient to Museumplein, and don't mind possibly having to traipse upstairs to take a shower, the Kooyk is fine. Don't expect to pay this price and have the amenities and service you'd get at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy, creepy and weird. Pass over this one, not worth your time”
Reviews.Author: KwahuMan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to this hotel on leisure in late 2008 and stayed for 3 days. We were a bit hesitant to book this place initially given the poor reviews we had read on tripadvisor and the fact that it was a 1-star. After staying here, we now know the reason for all the poor reviews; this hotel is one to avoid by all means! First, the bedding in our room was dirty, smelly and certainly hadnâ€™t been changed for at least 3 months. The room smelt of dew and there were cockroaches and other insects crawling on the floor. Second, the â€˜private showerâ€™ as advertised on the website at the time of booking; turned out to actually be a â€˜shared showerâ€™. Further, this shared shower was disgusting, dirty and equivalent to entering a storage container or unit. We refused to take any more showers over the period of our 3 day stay. Third, our room was totally inaccessible. To get to it we needed to go up a very steep set of stairs, with very short steps (depth). Not ideal for ladies travelling with a lot of luggage or anyone with back problems. Finally, the ultimate reason to avoid this hotel is the very odd experience my partner and I had where we retired for the night at close to 11pm and woke up the following day at 2.30pm! Thatâ€™s 15 Â½ hours sleep. Security to our room was very patchy and Iâ€™m not sure what to make of the whole incident. So letting you know of our experience in case you are thinking of going to this hotel. All in all, avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sean W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February (5th, 6th and 7th) after advice from a friend who had already been a guest here. Arrived late on the Friday and rang the doorbell to be greeted by a friendly young Dutch girl who checked us in swiftly and went over the house rules etc. The rooms themselves are very no-frills: sink, couple of beds, television and a wardrobe. The TV was not working, taps were wrongly labelled for hot and cold, wardrobe a bit slanted although beds were okay. Toilet and shower were shared and our room (18) was close to both. The toilet is a touch small but the shower has good pressure and plenty of hot water. Breakfast is served between 8am and 10am with toast, bread and spreads, tea/coffee, meat and cheese all available with hard boiled egss. Considering the breakfast laid on is included within the price of your room, value overall is excellent. As the hotel was simply a base for the weekend, all I did there is included in the above and I have no more to say. My overall rating is: Very Good. Taking into consideration the price, location and friendliness, you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, fab location and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mel_shock
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a typical Amsterdam hotel, tall and narrow with steep stairs but these are by far not the worst we have encountered!!! The proprietor met us at the door at 10am 4 hours early for check-in but was very friendly and helpful, we stored our luggage and settled up for the room at this time as well, Our room when we got in there was a great size (#12) it was downstairs next to the office and the only one it seemed on this level, it overlooked the garden and had double French doors leading on to this, the bed whilst not the newest was comfortable and the room was warm (it was November!!) For toilet facilities you use shared ones located on each landing in our case it appeared we were the only ones using the toilet so nice and private.....there are also showers available as well, it is a pity that toilets are not en-suite but as yet have not found anywhere that does this in this class of hotel....... You have to remember with this hotel that it does what it says on the tin, its a one star budget class hotel, so whilst it is a bit rough round the edges it is clean and good value as breakfast is included and for the location poses excellent value. I have used this hotel 3 times now and only the second time did we get a not so nice room, but this was only because it was dark and the window opened on to the internal light well, but again it was clean etc. Breakfast is ample with the usual bread or toast, cold meats, cheese, preserves, boiled eggs, juice, tea/coffee, this is all buffet style so it's help yourself and no limits (within reason of course) it is also topped up as it runs out...... I would not hesitate to use this hotel again or recommend it to others. The hotel is situated at the back of the Leidseplein square, central area for entertainment, bars, museums and only a one minute walk from the Melkweg venue so very handy for staying over when seeing artists peform etc, it is also on a tram route with a choice of 3 trams (1,2 & 5) that will take you back to Centraal station and Dam Square etc, so getting around is no issue at all. The area is a busy vibrant place but can be a bit on the price side.

Reviews.Title: “it was fine!”
Reviews.Author: kam2350
Reviews.Content: This is not the place for you if you worry about extras, fresh paint jobs, artworks or posturepedic beds with cotton linen, but my partner and I were happy enough at Kooyk. We stayed for 3 nights. Got the train form the airport and a tram from the main station, then walked across the canal. Locals are willing to help if you get lost. Our room was outdated but large, with the window facing out to the canal and street corner. No noise and pretty to look out. We shared toilet/shower with ground floor occupants - no big deal. Around the corner is a square with bars and local eateries at good prices. There's also arthouse cinemas, concert halls and close to art galleries. If you've got walking shoes on though , most parts of the city are easily accessable on foot from the hotel. My partner and I had a fabulous time exploring the city, getting lost and stopping at out-of-the-way cafes for apple pie and coffees. Also loved the breakfast spread each day at Kooyk!! Meat cuts, eggs, a variety of jams and breads/rolls, juice, cereal etc. YUMMY!! As we were there in winter, I was worried I may not be warm enough. Not a problem there either. I would recommend this spot to budget conscious, not too fussy people who want to put the luggage down, eat a good brekkie and get out and see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jackalackin
Reviews.Content: Seemed typical and cheap, very laid back and pleasant staff no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay for a few nights in the Dam”
Reviews.Author: mmm86
Reviews.Content: Location is very good for this hotel - it is close to transport links and most attractions are within a 20-25min walk. It is just set off a busy square, but noise wasnt an issue ( apart from morning when there always seemed to be some workings goin on-but at least it meant we got up at a good time). The room was fine and clean, double bed was two twins pushed together, which was ok, but not great. Tv had many working channels and there was a sink also. Big large door/windows into the back for fresh air. Clean room, but pillows were a bit crappy. bed was made for us everyday. Security was ok, the door had a double lock from the inside and a swipe card from the outside ( also used for the main entrance). They had securiy deposits, which we didnt use. We wouldnt have felt safe to leave any valuables in the room though. The rooms were clean and the bathroom and toilet were also clean. However,the toilet was the tinyest thing ever!You could JUST about fit! THe shower was ok, but the only problem was the constant smell of damp everytime you walked past the shower room ( which for us was everytime we went to out room!). The breakfast room was lovely and the breakfast was also good. There were either boiled or scrambled eggs, toast or bread, butter, jams,nutella, cheese and a selction of cold meats, tea and coffee. The staff were welcoming and pleasant. We noticed a computer and also a vending machine with snacks, which i suppose is good if you get hungry. All in all, it was fine, just the damp smell and tiny toilet really that needs improving. Also, if you pay by card its 5%, so i'd recommend bringing cash!

Reviews.Title: “I'd never go back”
Reviews.Author: cristaleo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for four nights in Oct/08, and those were the most terrible nights of our 1 month stay in Europe. First of all, our room on the second floor could only be reached through the infamous steepest stairway I've ever seen. Then, we arrived in a pretty large room, with a balcony, which at first seemed quite nice. At 3am, 4am and 6am, when other guests used this balcony for their own post-party purposes, our mind had changed. Again, the curtain was hanging and whe had little privacy. The other day, when we complained about curtain and noise, we were told (apparently by the owner) that it was normal for people to use our balcony to stage late parties, and subsequently we were asked why we considered that abnomal (maybe sleeping pattenrs are different there). The curtain was never fixed and we had to arrange something ourselves. Nevertheless, It must be said that there was at least a friendly face on staff, who helped me with the issue of my stolen passaport and that breakfast was quite good. We couldn't sleep, though, so it was a major down point.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you're not too picky.”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly T
Reviews.Content: The best thing was location/price. It's right in the middle of the Museum Dist on Tram/Bus/Canal lines to everywhere. Nightlife was right around the corner too. The place itself is somewhere between a hotel and a hostel. The room I had was clean and included a sink & TV. The bathroom down the hall and the shower down the other hall were both clean too. Breakfast every morning was simple but it hit the spot. My only complaint was the noise...the walls seemed a little thin and I could hear most everything going on outside my room. Nothing a few earplugs didn't solve. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLover83
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled all over Europe this summer, and this was by far the worst place we stayed. Our room smelled like mildew and the showers were covered with bugs on the ceiling and on the walls. We had read reviews before on the site, but decided to give it a chance. While the staff was nice and friendly and the breakfast was decent, we felt that it was majorly overpriced for an unclean environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but twas okay.”
Reviews.Author: nessa_11
Reviews.Content: Had stayed here for two nights slightly over a year ago during October 2007. Room was minimal, a little run down, but okay. Single large window couldn't be opened or closed and the radiator didn't seem to work. Didn't get a canal-facing room so the only gloomy view outta window showed other parts of the building. Bed creaked a little and the simple room furniture appeared to be a little old and moldy. Shared bathroom and toilet down the hallway were clean though. Basically, this building is pretty old and has quite a bit of character. Stairs are amazingly steep and narrow which is really interesting. Breakfast buffet spread was nice and fresh every morning. Though this establishment isn't all that close to the train station, I liked this location for it is in a nice, quiet setting overlooking a neighborhood sitting just across the canal. This hotel is also relatively close to the Rijksmusuem which is a must-see. May recommend this hotel to my non-fussy friends but would definitely advise them to go for the canal-facing rooms since, according to the reviews of the other guests, those sounded alot nicer than the room i got.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Pala32
Reviews.Content: I also really liked this place. It is a budget hotel with many typically Dutch quirks. The ground floor terras room is great, very large. The exterior French doors are not Fort Knox, but I was not concerned. I believe we were the only ones using the WC on that hallway. The breakfast was typical and filling. Having hot eggs is nice. The staff were all friendly and accommodating. The showers are not the best, and were occasionally busy. The value more than compensates, for me at least.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved it.”
Reviews.Author: MissLibrarianUK
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights at the end of June, in a fantastic ground floor room - Number 12. It was lovely and big with two chairs and a table, comfy double bed and french doors leading out into the small courtyard garden at the back. We had stayed in a budget hotel near the Kooyk previously in the year and the Kooyk was cheaper, nearer to the action (it is a fantastic location - although it looks quite far on the map it is only a 20 minute walk from Centraal Station. You don't need to take the tram just have a good map with streetnames on it.) and very welcoming indeed. The staff were very helpful and kind, particularly the owner. Although he never saw my fellow at breakfast -he's not a morning person! - he kindly let me take a glass of juice into our room for him. Also because the hotel is non-smoking (as all are now due to changing smoking laws) we enquired whether we could smoke in the garden and they were very accomodating despite the fact it wasn't just tobacco. It was a pleasure to have this private smoking area - coupled with the TV which we had set to comedy central at night! It's not the Ritz - but seeing as it is a budget hotel it would be foolish to expect otherwise. I thought it was excellent value for money and I am hoping to return again next year. Thank you all at Kooyk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Talani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family suite with 6 single beds. The hostel is really run down and really old, however the male manager there was so helpful and lovely it kind of made up for it. There are some funny smells around the place, especially in the showers, it smelt a bit like sewage. There were 2 showers upstairs and 1 shower downstairs. There never seemed to be a line for the showers which was quite amazing considering there seemed to be so few. The breakfast was really nice. It consisted of ham, eggs, cheese, juice, tea, coffee. Even though this place is really old, the location is fantastic and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but well within the budget”
Reviews.Author: MacDutch
Reviews.Content: Even though it has been a long time since we stayed (Summer of 2005), it was memorable enough to say that what I do remember is the tightness of everything. I realise Amsterdam mostly only has narrow stairways, but this one took the cake!! The security was pretty good with the card, the breakfast was okay but in clean surroundings, the bed was okay for the price, the location was a little of track, but lots more to see when you aren't straight in the heart of things. Would probably not stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcm26
Reviews.Content: After reading some terrible reviews I was worried about staying here but it turned out to be an excellent hotel. My partner and I paid 120 pounds for three nights so it was really really cheap. We were given a room on the ground floor so I don't know about the lethal stairs but I was suprised at how big our room was compared to the other hotels in Amsterdam. It was a sweet room with nice comfy double bed, sink and TV. We had a wardrobe and two comfy armchairs. The toilet was fine, the shower room was just a tiled room with no windos but you only spend 5 minutes in there and it does the job. The breakfast was great; meat, eggs,cheese, jam, toast, coffee, juice. All the usual stuff. Really pretty breakfast room too. the rooms were cleaned everyday and new towels were put in everyday too. The owners and hotel staff were lovely, even borrowing us an adapter for our stay as I'd forgotton ours. Best of all was the location. Overlooking a canal and 30 seconds from the lively Leidseplein area. I don't know how people can complain about this hotel. Yes it's not 5 star but it's really cheap. If you are looking for a cosy B&B which is clean and friendly then this is a great option. Sometimes I think people just complain about the smallest things and they are always the people who pay hardly any money and expect the Ritz. I haven't got my photos to upload now but I purposefully took some of the room to put on here as I couldn't believe what a great deal we got.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: avfcandy
Reviews.Content: As most people would have done, me and my four friends opted for this establishment because of the cheapness of the rooms to help save pennies for expensive Amsterdam. My first impression was that the hotel looked the type of place that would be owned by a stuffy pensioner who would want everyone in their beds by 11pm - however we were greeted by the very friendly and genunine woman at reception (probably the owner). She had a good sense of humour, pointed out some Amsterdam sights on the map and knew that we would be out until the wee small hours! After hiking up the EXTREMLEY narrow and steep staircase we found some very oddly decorated, but very spacious rooms. The place looks like somehting that wouldn't look out of place in a horror movie but for some where cheap to put down your head - it does the job. I can't comment on the food because I didn't get up early enough to sample the breakfast. The only grumbles that I would have is that it's quite a long way from the main areas of Amsterdam if you plan to walk everywhere and having to leave your room for the loo or shower can be a bit of a pain in the backside. However it's ideal for the money. A friendly man even happily cleaned up my friend's sick in the middle of the night after he vomited outside the front entrance of the hotel after a heavy session - that's service for you!

Reviews.Title: “6 Beds, Son!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMS4LIFE
Reviews.Content: This place was ridickerous!!! (as in AWESOME) First, to even enter the place, you need the magic password to bypass the office lady. But once payment was completed, she informed us of our freaking awesome luxury 6-bedroom apartment, which was awesome. She took us up stair cases imported from mount everest (if you're more than 19 stones, stay off the stairs and probably the floor). Before going on your voyage, you MUST makes sure to take a douche and only pack one pair of clothes because you won't have time to douche or change. Also, the schitter's all backwards, son!!!! If you're confused by this point, you should make a booking now, and experience it for yourself. Freakin' Awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Detschal
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very disgusting! They donÂ´t look like as on the pictures! You canÂ´t open the windows, Â´cause theÂ´re locked! Smoking is not allowed and nobody tells you that by booking the rooms. You have to pay the rooms completley before youÂ´ve seen them!!! The "bathroom" is a little tiled chamber and if you donÂ´t are a big dirtbag you donÂ´t shower in there!!! We didnÂ´t get any money back! As we tell Mrs.Monique, that we leave the hotel, she got very very angry and abused us!! So PLEASE donÂ´t book rooms in the Kooyk Hotel! Your trip to Amsterdam may be a trip to hell!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and nice”
Reviews.Author: Gabsterz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in the month of July. I really enjoyed my stay. The room was spacious and clean and it over looked the canal. The room had two massive windows which took up an entire wall. My room had beautiful carving on the walls and a chandelier. It also had four beds, two sinks, one couch and a fake fireplace. There is no individual bathroom, only shared bathroom for each floor. Itâ€™s in the Leidseplein (Leidse Square) district, since the hotel is not on the main street it isnâ€™t that loud. But occasionally you do hear people enjoying themselves. There is no elevator and it has very steep stairs so donâ€™t bring heavy luggage. The staff was pretty nice and normal nothing out of the ordinary, the front door can only be open by your room key, so those unwelcome guests canâ€™t get in! I left personal belonging in clear view at all times and nothing ever went missing. Overall I enjoyed my stay and most likely I will be staying with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going again”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and it was fine, but this time was disappointing. The keycard we were given didn't work and the receptionist didn't have another. She was not very friendly about it The room had 2 very cheap single beds that had thin uncomfortable mattresses and thin lumpy pillows and a thin duvet. Not comfy! Also they creaked and groaned if you moved. Then in the middle of the night there was a huge racket from upstairs, it sounded like someone was moving house, for about 2 hours. I couldn't work out if it was part of the hotel or a separate flat, but it was really loud and I didn't get much sleep. Luckily we were leaving the next morning so it didn't spoil the holiday, I would have been gutted if I had paid for more nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, not the Pits!!”
Reviews.Author: Pyr8
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from the Hotel Kooyk, and had a wonderful time. On booking the room, the website I used could only offer a double bed, I needed twin beds so I emailed the hotel directly to see if I could change. They were very quick to reply and changed the reservation with no problems. After reading some of the the reviews on this site, I was worried about what I would find when I arrived. I was pleasantly suprised though. We arrived a bit later than expected, and were greeted by a very friendly man who checked us in quickly and gave us our key. Our room (23) was on the second floor, and like many hotels in Amsterdam, you have to get up a few flights of very steep (almost ship like) steps. The room was basic, but clean enough and had a wash basin. The beds were comfortable with clean sheets, and there was also a tv in the room. The toilet was small, but how big do you need it to be really? There were two showers right next to our room, (so I don't understand why someone said they could only find one in the whole hotel) but the queue in the morning, like anywhere, can be quite lengthy. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because we were never ready in time, but it is served until 10am, and didn't hear any complaints at all. (Beds must have been really uncomfortable for us to lie in that late huh?) This was my fourth stay at the Leidseplein, and most hotels seem to be much of a muchness. They tend to be tall thin buildings, with very steep steps, and most smell damp due to the fact that the whole place is built around canals. This hotel is fab for the price, at Â£25.00 per night (this is the busy season) including breakfast, it's a bargain. There are plenty of far more expensive hotels around there (I have stayed in a few) with rooms of the same standard. It is very close to the Leidse Square, bars, restaurants etc, (about 5 mins away on foot) and there are a constant supply of trams to get you to different places and back. (buy tram tickets for these at newsagents, and get a route map from the internet before you go. They are an interesting way to travel, just make sure you jump off as soon as the doors open, or you could end up going on a mystery tour, I know!!) The staff are very friendly, and although our flight wasn't until 10pm, they allowed us to leave our luggage there all day, and ordered a taxi to the airport for us. (30 Euros). We go to Amsterdam to enjoy it and see the sights, we have no need to spend vast amounts of time in our room, and this hotel did the job. It is in no worse state than other hotels I have stayed in here, and is less expensive. If the owners refurbed, it would be obviously more expensive. If you want Crowne Plaza luxury, then stay there and pay those prices.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be closed”
Reviews.Author: Bart_MD
Reviews.Content: First I'd like to say I'm not the kind of person who wants all hotels to be five stars establishments. On the contrary. I like hotels which are modest and charming, but the one thing they should be, is being clean! This hotel was a real nightmare. There were blood stains and sigarette burns on the blankets. The room had a view on a wall covered with pigeon droppings. Television was defect. The carpet came loose on the borders, revaling a whole collection of dirt and dust underneath. Our room was never cleaned during our stay, nor did we get new blankets. Our night lamp was broken on arrival and we had taken the bulb out and put it on the bed to give them a clue the other day it needed replacement. It worked, we got a new light bulb. We didn't shower during our three day stay, since the shower was a public commodity and smelled nasty. On the brochure we read there were at least three showers on each corridor, we only found one in the entire hotel. Breakfast was simple but good. We got some roasted slices of bread with a boiled egg and only one (1) glass of orange juice. We could choose from jam and a slice of cheese and ham. The staff itself was warm and welcoming. We did have the impression the owner was getting too old to run this establishement. When we stayed there, the facade was being renovated (februari 2005). Maybe now the hotel is in much better shape?

Reviews.Title: “Funky, but nice location”
Reviews.Author: rev-24
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is outrageously expense, so we decided to stay at the Kooyk hotel for the weekend for it's price of 80 euros/night. Booked online. Location is right near the Leidesplein and next on the canal near the Americain hotel. Nice quite, location, however, the hotel rooms are pretty funky. The front lady was really nice and gave us a quick rundown of Amersterdam. The rooms were funky- kind of small for 3 people- the triple is a regular room with an extra bed. The main issue was with our french doors that looked out to the little square. Although, everything looked safe, only one of the bottom bolts would lock. Luckily no one busted in, and we had a good time in Amsterdam. Maids come in during the day and clean the room, so use your discretion on what you leave in the room. Our stuff was fine, but who knows. The beds were not special, but clean sheets. The showers and bathrooms were clean despite the prehistoric Netherlands flushing system, but small bathrooms. Thebreakfast area was nice, and the food decent. Rember only one glass of orange juice per person... Overall- the location would out way the funky rooms if it wasn't for the broken French doors...

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: steff85
Reviews.Content: We paid 55 euro for a friday and saturday night. We wern't expecting the ritz but I was pleastently suprised. The room was big, we had a working tv and the beds were very comfortable. We also had a lovely view of the canal. We were lucky enough to have our room on the floor with the showers on. Which were lovely and warm, sometimes a little too hot! The breakfast was ok just bread meat and cheese, although on the first day we very nearly missed the breakfast and she was a scary lady telling us we were very late, but a little man still gave us some orange juice and toast so we were happy. They let you leave your bags in the hotel which was good as our flight was not until 10pm and they ordered a taxi which was only 30 euro. The location was fantastic and there were many trams which would take you to dam square, but there were loads of resturants and bars within the square. It was not far to walk anywhere although it is cold! The only drawback to this hotel I would say were the stairs but they are the typical stairs in amsterdam and it did add an element of excitement especially when had a few drinks! Also there was only one key card to a 4 bed room which was a bit rubbish if you got split up. I would definately stay here again you cant complain for the price we paid and the location was fantastic. It probably isn't the best hotel in the world but I'm sorry people who pay 20 euro a night cant' expect 5* luxury!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: biz55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 22,the room itself was absolutely disgusting dirty carpets(where there was carpets),the walls and skirting boards were also pretty stinking,as for the rooms facilities,central heating was broken,the tv was broken.the window was broken and to top it all off the lock on the door was broken!when asked to rectify the problems or provide another room they were hopeless and our luggage was left unlocked in the room everytime we went out which was quite often as you couldn't have stayed in there a minute longer than you had to.There wasn't one thing in the room that worked.the beds were the most uncomfortable metal contraptions and the two shared showers and toilet were basically joined onto the room so you could hear every person on your floor going to either.It was the worst room i have stayed in anywhere in the world and the staff were worse than useless.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Bad Budget Hotel Here Guys”
Reviews.Author: wigster
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in a lot of hotels over the years in Amsterdam. mainly buget ones cos they are cheap. (the best one being the Acro Hotel by the way-& the only one i would return to). anyways, the Kooyk was actually ok. i was worried before hand as the room only cost me 20 GBP for the night!! the room i had was a single with shared facilities. it was bigger than some doubles/twins i have stayed in i can tell you (avoid the Quintin England if youre a lone traveller by the way, theirs is a cupboard with no windows!!). my room at the Kooyk had 2 single beds in, but only one was made up as i was staying on my own. also had a TV -but it didnt work-i didnt care as it was only for one night. the window didnt shut, due to the fact a bit of 2 x 4 was wedged in it, so the room was a bit damp also. despite the above my night was OK :O) you can do a lot lot worse on a budget in Amsterdam. so be carefull & read the reviews on here as they always help me to decide. breakfast was ok & the staff very friendly too. many thanks & take it easy all, wigmund

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodations in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: 10issne1
Reviews.Content: Face it, folks, we get what we pay for. Mostly. Hopefully. Amsterdam is simply not an easy city in which to spend a restful night on a shoestring budget. The first good thing about Kooyk is its terrific location, just off the Leidseplein right in the heart of old Amsterdam with streetcars only a block away. The breakfast was more than ample and satisfying. What else to share? Well, toilets are not in your room, but that's typical. There are only two shower closets, on the top floor, and no place to hang your dry clothing there except under your towel and hope for the best. Everything here is basic to the extreme but if cheap is what you're looking for, you'll do okay.

Reviews.Title: “Temperamental dinner lady”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought it would be a great place to stay, according to hostel world's comments, but i was wrong. When we arrived before 12 pm first day, we were greeted by a lady staff who seemed angry that we arrived then!. Nevermind that. There were 2 other staff who were friendly, sorts of neutralises things. But when we checked in properly later, the door to our room couldn't be closed properly. the hinge was broken. Nevermind tht, we told the reception ppl and hope they would fix it. NOpes, they didn't do that either. We spent the next few days trying sturggling to open our door. Then, the shower head was faulty, the bar was ripped from the wall. Nevermind tht. We decided it wasn't worth our efforts to ask them to repair it (too tired after a long day). Thankfully, some irritated customers probably demanded it to be fixed and it was the next day. Then, 2nd day, the toilet flushing line was broken, yes, again, so i had to climb onto the toilet seat to flush the toilet. Nevermind tht. It was miriculously fixed with a rope the next day, hurrah! no need to climb onto toilet seats again. And we had to leave pretty early last day, so we couldn't get our breakfast ready by then. FIne, it was a fault on my part for overlooking that when booking the flight tickets. I tried to explain and asked the dinner lady (the same angry lady at the reception) in a very nice manner, whether she could maybe prepare a sandwich for us before we left in the morning. She reprimanded me and was RUDE becoz it was my fault, (as if i didn't know). Nevermind that, at least i tried to get my money's worth, since i DID pay for the breakfast. She promised half heartedly to prepare it, and then on the day itself, she just did not bother. Nevermind tht. Since amsterdam was a really nice place for a relaxing trip.. we weren't fussed about it, until we saw this website and realised tht we weren't the only ones who were not satisfied with the service at this budget hotel. Hmm, 72 euros per nite per room. Price isn't worth it. I personally wouldn't go back there again. maybe i will, if they change to NICER staff who don't make you uncomfortable and UNwelcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and cozy”
Reviews.Author: caitlinette
Reviews.Content: I haven't read the other reviews of this hotel yet, but I've seen some of the opening lines -- rude owner, icy shower, etc. The owner, Pierre, was absolutely friendly to us. He was always smiling and helpful -- definitely quirky. (Maybe he liked me because I always greeted him in Dutch?) That's why I liked this place. The interior smells kind of like licorice and smoke, but it's not strong, and it adds to its odd coziness. The room we stayed in, #7 downstairs, was simple and warm, with a really comfortable bed. Some of the travelers upstairs were noisy, but only one night, so just bring earplugs in case. We never had any problems with the shower. The location of this place is fabulous. It's right around the corner to Leidseplein and right by the Rijksmuseum, Vondelpark, trams, theaters, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great for the money and location”
Reviews.Author: chariot
Reviews.Content: We were a group of girls staying here for a birthday weekend in Amsterdam so wanted a budget hotel near all the action of Leidesplein. It's a GREAT location for this, just round the corner, so saving our high heeled feet for dancing! The hotel is an old building so be aware the stairs are steep and narrow. Our room was nice and big, with a seating area as well as sleeping areas, plenty of storage and a sink with hot and cold water. The plug sockets were a bit wobbly though, but after a bit of wiggling we were able to use them. We had clean towels to use and the room got cleaned/beds made and the towels replaced each day. The beds were comfortable too. We had a great view of the canal and the toilet was just across the corridor, and another one just down the corridor, although these were small they were clean and had plenty of toilet paper all the time. The showers were ok, and although I never had a hot one, some of the others did - I guess it just depended on which one you went in. The staff were friendly and spoke good english although found it a bit difficult to split our bill - and there is a surcharge for paying by card, so it would be easier to pay all as one group. She also came to our room later to claim the 90 cents that she had left off the bill!! Note also that there is a 10 Euro deposit you have to pay for your key which you get back at the end of your stay. We were able to leave our bags there after checkout (in one of the corridors) until we wanted to pick them up. For the price of the room and the location, it was a great place to stay on a budget, and if I was going back in a group I would definitely stay there again, we had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “close to the bulldog”
Reviews.Author: bub
Reviews.Content: me & my friend spent 3 nights here in december 2004 & found it good value for the money..breakfast was good although we managed to sleep in 2 mornings out of the 3 that we were there..must have been the late nights out visiting coffeeshops...i would use it again without hesitation and had no complaints about anything..staff were helpful and spoke good english..it is nicely placed to the bulldog and many other cafes...great value for the money and when i return to the dam will be staying at the kyook

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews of Owner's temper scared me off!!”
Reviews.Author: cmv56
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I have not stayed in this hotel, but I had reserved a single room in this hotel for 6 nights in September of 2005 based upon the general description of the hotel given on the various hotel booking websites. However, upon reading some of the reviews from this website that described the Owner's overly tempermental reactions to apparently justifiable complaints (reviews from Nov. 9 2004, especially Oct. 25 2004, and March 4 2003) I decided that I did not want to try my luck with such a hotelier, and booked the same 6 nights for 20 euros less with Hotel Abba instead, whose numerous positive reviews on this website tipped the balance of chance in favour of a better overall experience. (Someone needs to tell this guy that he's being reviewed and it's not all good!) I have been to Amsterdam many times. Travellers from the States (I'm American by the way, living in the UK) should understand that in general, these budget hotels are situated in very old (hundreds of years in many cases) buildings and that the general architecture of these row houses is vertical (very vertigo staircases) with extremely small (by modern standards) rooms! They do what they can with what they've got. So please don't have culture shock in this regard. If you're coming to Old World Europe, there's bound to be Old World character! However, rudeness by current Owners, saggy beds, and general uncleanliness is avoidable, and I choose to avoid these types of confrontations. I'm sure the breakfast is lovely, but if something goes wrong, I wouldn't want to have to approach an indignant and tempermental Owner, no matter how little I'm paying for the room! I think this type of review process is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else (really).”
Reviews.Author: CT2DC
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a lovely city with many, many hotels. I would advise that you find somewhere else to stay than the Kooyk Hotel. The service and accomodations were sub par, and certainly below the standards of most decent youth hostels in Europe. Decidingly NOT worth the â‚¬70 price. Reservations: Our confirmed canal view room was unavailable at check in due to "flooding" and a ground floor garden room substituted. We were also told that there was a 5% surcharge for using a credit card--information not revealed when making the initial reservation. Room: The room was spartan and dingy, with a strong odor of cleanser attempting to cover the pervasive smell of mildew.
